channel.title: Ubuntu Installation Making Me Go Insane
channel.description:
I've been spending the last 2 weeks, day and night trying to install Linux to my Digital Western Elements 2.0 USB Hard Drive.
I've followed guides from Pendrivelinux as well as advice from members on here (Ubuntu Forums), with no solution. I'm starting to give up on Linux...
When using the LiveCD to install Edgy Eft to my USB hard drive (/dev/sdb) I get the following error: [CODE]the ext3 file system creation in partition #1 opf SCSIS (0,0,0) (sdb) failed/[/CODE]
This closes the installation.
I have tried manually partitioning the hard drive using Paragon Partitioner, as well as manually partitioning it through the Linux installer, to no success at all.
Please help...

item.title: Ubuntu Installation Making Me Go Insane
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:5, topic:96848”]Hey Chris, recently I found a new way to install Ubuntu without the hassle of the LiveCD. Just go on your Windows operating system and download an exe file. Install it, and reboot, and viola! Ubuntu is installed! I haven’t tested this, but I have heard and read that it works.

Here is the link. Hope it helps!
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=427540[/quote]

Thanks for the link. I’ll try it out, and just hope that it is able to put itself on a external hard drive.

Read full topic
item.source: Ubuntu Installation Making Me Go Insane

item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Hey Chris, recently I found a new way to install Ubuntu without the hassle of the LiveCD. Just go on your Windows operating system and download an exe file. Install it, and reboot, and viola! Ubuntu is installed! I haven’t tested this, but I have heard and read that it works.

Here is the link. Hope it helps!
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=427540

item.title: Ubuntu Installation Making Me Go Insane
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

The Un-Named:

Maybe the harddrive can’t read or write ext3.

There’s no reason it shouldn’t. I have managed to install Ubuntu, but it just hung on boot. Ever since I was never able to install.

Read full topic
item.source: Ubuntu Installation Making Me Go Insane

item.title: Ubuntu Installation Making Me Go Insane
item.dc:creator: @Painless Painless
item.description:
@Painless wrote:

I’m new to Linux, so I don’t really know… However, it might be the hard drive. Try installing it under something besides ext3.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Installation Making Me Go Insane
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I’ve been spending the last 2 weeks, day and night trying to install Linux to my Digital Western Elements 2.0 USB Hard Drive.

I’ve followed guides from Pendrivelinux as well as advice from members on here (Ubuntu Forums), with no solution. I’m starting to give up on Linux…

When using the LiveCD to install Edgy Eft to my USB hard drive (/dev/sdb) I get the following error:

the ext3 file system creation in partition #1 opf SCSIS (0,0,0) (sdb) failed/

This closes the installation.

I have tried manually partitioning the hard drive using Paragon Partitioner, as well as manually partitioning it through the Linux installer, to no success at all.

Please help…
